answerText: siRNA [or small interfering RNA; or short interfering RNA; prompt on silencing RNA; or "ribonucleic acid" for RNA where appropriate][10] The mechanism of RNA interference was first studied by Fire and Mello in this model organism, a nematode.
heading: ACF Regionals 2014 |2014 | Maryland A-Kansas State-Penn C | 19 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this type of double-stranded RNA used in RNA interference which forms perfect base pairs to its target mRNA sequence, unlike miRNA. It is used to knock down genes because the mRNA gets cleaved.
